chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Blank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

9:12 AM 2021CF000087, 2021CF000094, 2022CF000012, 2022CF000047, 2022CF000112, 2022CF000113 - Defendant Daniel J Blank in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states the joint agreement to enter pleas in 2021CF000087; count 2, 2021CF000094; count 1, 2, 5, 2022CF000047; count 2, 2022CF000112; count 2, and 2022CF000113; count 1. All other counts and cases will be DRI.

Court review the plea questionnaire. Court goes over the maximum penalties. Court finds a factual basis. DB enters a plea of NC. Court finds the defendant guilty. Attorney Forehand heard and speaks about her conversations with the victim. Attorney Burdick heard. DB heard.

2021CF000087; count 2, 2021CF000094; count 1 and 2, 2022CF000047; count 2:

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 2 years.

Conditions:
No contact with the victim.
Participate and successfully complete domestic abuse counseling.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges on 21CF94

Credit in the event of revocation: 5 days credit   (Attorney Burdick will petition the court if there is more credit then 5 days.)
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today


2021CF000094; Count 5
Court orders: 30 days in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him.
Huber granted.

2022CF000112; Count 2
Court orders: 9 months in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him; consecutive to 22CF94
Huber granted.
Credit of 50 days.

2022CF000113
Court orders: 60 days in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him; consecutive to 22CF94 and 22CF112
Huber granted.
Costs ordered.

2022CF000012 - DRI

All other counts DRI.

11:10 AM 22CF112/22CF113 - Defendant Daniel J Blank in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick speaks orders that are filed to un-recuse Judge McDougal. Attorney Burdick has spoken with Judge Rood's JA. Orders from Judge Rood have not been signed. Attorney Forehand speaks about the victim needing to speak with her and asks for a reset for next week. 

Attorney Burdick speaks about amending the bond. Attorney Forehand will try to speak with victim before speaking about bond. Court asks about how much bond can be posted.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:43 PM 22CF112/22CF113 - Defendant Daniel J Blank appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick speaks about DB other cases with Judge Rood and speaks about getting Judge McDougal on those cases. 

Attorney Burdick enters a plea of NG on behalf of DB on both cases. Max penalties stated. Formal reading waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8/30/22 Court grants a furlough so that Defendant may attend the funeral of a family member. During the furlough period, this cash bond shall convert to a $5000 signature bond. After the furlough, it converts back to a $5000 cash bond. The furlough period during which the Defendant may be released, to the custody of David Blank or Nicki Blank (David or Nicki must provide identification to the jail), is from Wednesday, August 31, 2022 at 6 p.m. until Friday, September 2, 2022 at 8 a.m. During this furlough period, Defendant may only be at the following places: at his father's residence or enroute or back from the funeral, attending the service or whatever reception there is, returning to his father's residence afterwards, pending return to the jail. Court orders absolute sobriety - no alcohol, no drugs not prescribed to Def. Def not to leave father's residence and must be in the company of David Blank or Nicki Blank the entire time. Def to sign this bond in order for it to be in effect.

Previous bond conditions remain in effect: No contact with AM.

1:40 PM 22CF112 and 22CF113. Defendant Daniel J Blank in court, in custody. Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank. Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Def is requesting to attend the funeral of a first cousin Thursday, 9/1/22. Atty. Burdick moves for a brief furlough with bond to state that relatives present ID at the jail for Def's release for specific times (and return for specific time). Atty. Forehand asks where the services are. Def does not have the details; his family has them. He provides the name of the deceased; Atty. Forehand tries to locate the obituary for confirmation of the service date, time, and location; without that, State does not have enough information to make a recommendation but is not objecting to the furlough. Defense is asking for release from Wednesday to Friday. Court does not believe it is necessary for a furlough from Wednesday to Friday as Def has indicated his father, who is local, will be picking him up; Court is willing to allow a furlough for Thursday. Defendant states he'd like time to see family members at the funeral. Court grants the furlough starting Wednesday at 6 p.m. until Friday at 8 a.m. Def may be at his father's residence or en route or back from the funeral, attending the service or whatever reception there is, meaning that he return to his father's residence immediately after the service, pending return to the jail. Court orders absolute sobriety - no alcohol, no drugs not prescribed to Def. Def not to leave father's residence and must be in the company of David Blank or Nicki Blank the entire time. Atty. Burdick asks for this to be per order rather a bond modification. Court orders a furlough as described, however, specifically states that the Def is subject to the conditions of his release described. Court orders this be as an amended bond, allowing for release on signature bond during the time of the stated furlough. Def to sign the amended bond. 

Next date, arraignment, set for 9/26 at 1 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:44 PM Defendant Daniel J Blank in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF112 and 22CF113 were set for prelim today. Counsel indicate that the parties wish to waive the prelim. Atty. Burdick informs the Court that the Def has suffered a death in the family and asks for scheduling bond hearings in these matters; presents the Court with the written waiver of prelim. Court's colloquy with Def re prelim waiver. Prelim waivers accepted. Bindover ordered. Bond hearing set for 8/30 at 1:30 p.m.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Burdick has received the complaint but hasn't been able to review them with the defendant. Attorney Burdick waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about the preliminary hearing. Attorney Burdick would  like the preliminary hearing done in 10 days. Court states that there is training next week and asks about 08/29/22. Attorney Burdick waives the time limits. DB concurs.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Erickson heard and asks for a signature bond. 
Attorney Burdick will be taking this cases.

Attorney Forehand states that she is asking for a signature bond in the case without the victim and with the victim she asks for a $10,000 cash bond.
